favorites.fact: favorite fact
5 is the most common number of gears for automobiles with manual transmission.
5 is the second Sierpinski number of the first kind, and can be written as S2=(22)+1.
112 is the number of surat al-Ikhlas in the Qur'an.
1215 is the smallest number n where n and n+1 are both products of 6 or more primes.
10 is the aliquot sum of only one number the discrete semiprime 14.
103 is a strictly non-palindromic number.
4 is the number of movements in a symphony.
52 is the 6th Bell number and a decagonal number.
123 is the 10^{th} Lucas number.
25 is an aliquot sum of 6 and number 6 is the first (or smallest) number to have an aliquot sequence that does not culminate in 0 through a prime.
February 21st is the day in 1974 that the last Israeli soldiers leave the west bank of the Suez Canal pursuant to a truce with Egypt.
2 is the only number x such that the sum of the reciprocals of the powers of x equals itself.
2 is a primorial, as well as its own factorial.
2 is the third Fibonacci number, and the third and fifth Perrin numbers.
2 is the number of n-Queens Problem solutions for n = 4.
2 is many properties in mathematics.
5 is the number of babies born in a quintuplet.
5 is the number of appendages on most starfish, which exhibit pentamerism.
5 is the number of completed, numbered piano concertos of Ludwig van Beethoven, Sergei Prokofiev, and Camille Saint-Saëns.
82 is the number of games in an NBA or NHL regular season.
12 is the number of function keys on most PC keyboards (F1 through F12).
1273 is a boring number.
